LanguageData.Archer25.description: [PAWN_nameDef] fought for [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] and specialized in the use of bows, pila, and other ranged weapons.
LanguageData.Archer25.title: лучник
LanguageData.Banished68.description: [PAWN_nameDef]'s tribe banished [PAWN_objective] following a bloody dispute. [PAWN_pronoun] survived in the wilds alone for a long time.
LanguageData.Banished68.title: вигнанець
LanguageData.Brave88.description: [PAWN_nameDef] wielded ikwa, axes, clubs, and other close-ranged weapons in battles for [PAWN_possessive] tribe.
LanguageData.Brave88.title: сміливець
LanguageData.Butcher40.description: [PAWN_nameDef]'s main job in the hunting party was the butchering of animals. [PAWN_pronoun] became a master with the knife, able to extract every bit of value from a carcass in a short time.
LanguageData.Butcher40.title: м'ясник
LanguageData.Carver1.description: [PAWN_nameDef] carved artworks for [PAWN_possessive] tribe from wood, stone, and occasionally, more exotic materials. The work was sometimes sold, and sometimes kept to beautify settlements and provide a focus for rituals.
LanguageData.Carver1.title: різьбяр
LanguageData.CaveBuilder81.description: [PAWN_nameDef] specialized in cave complex excavation and construction.
LanguageData.CaveBuilder81.title: печерний будівельник
LanguageData.Digger31.description: [PAWN_nameDef] labored in mines and caves, digging out spaces for storing items and hiding from threats. [PAWN_possessive] work provided hiding spots for [PAWN_possessive] friends on many occasions.
LanguageData.Digger31.title: копач
LanguageData.Digger66.description: [PAWN_nameDef] carved living spaces and mined minerals from the sides of hills and mountains. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to feel at home picking through rock and shoring up cave walls.
LanguageData.Digger66.title: копач
LanguageData.Excavator55.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked at dig sites, extracting valuable items and materials from ancient compacted ruins. [PAWN_pronoun] learned how to spot valuables in the ground and use a variety of excavating tools.
LanguageData.Excavator55.title: археолог
LanguageData.Framer37.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was responsible for erecting structures for [PAWN_possessive] fellow tribespeople to live in. This included both temporary structures for nomadic travel, and permanent settlements. Gathering building materials from local plant life was part of the job.
LanguageData.Framer37.title: племінний будівельник
LanguageData.Gatherer70.description: Using [PAWN_possessive] knowledge of plants, roots, and berries, [PAWN_nameDef] could find food in even the most barren landscapes. [PAWN_pronoun] stayed away from animals.
LanguageData.Gatherer70.title: збирач
LanguageData.Healer46.description: After [PAWN_possessive] tribe's elder healer was killed in a raid, [PAWN_nameDef] took on the role. [PAWN_pronoun] spent [PAWN_possessive] days scrounging up herbs and mineral compounds from the nearby area to use in surprisingly effective remedies.
LanguageData.Healer46.title: цілитель
LanguageData.HearthTender66.description: While the others were out hunting and foraging, [PAWN_nameDef] would stay at home to cook and take care of the young and sick.
LanguageData.HearthTender66.title: ніжний вогонь
LanguageData.Herder33.description: [PAWN_nameDef] herded a variety of animals to help feed and clothe [PAWN_possessive] tribe while on the move. [PAWN_nameDef] learned how to calm and direct the beasts, and how to hunt [PAWN_possessive] own meals on the trail.
LanguageData.Herder33.title: тваринник племені
LanguageData.Hunter74.description: [PAWN_nameDef] tracked, trapped and killed animals for their meat and leather.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] used both ranged and melee weapons. Sometimes, [PAWN_pronoun] hunted alongside animals.
LanguageData.Hunter74.title: мисливець племені
LanguageData.Logger16.description: [PAWN_nameDef] chopped trees and hauled their lumber back to the tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] wielded [PAWN_possessive] axe with the finesse of an artist and the force of a charging muffalo.
LanguageData.Logger16.title: лісоруб племені
LanguageData.Loner61.description: [PAWN_nameDef] never much liked the tribal council or the yearly festivals. [PAWN_pronoun] preferred the open plain and the whistle of wind through the rocks.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] visited [PAWN_possessive] tribe from time to time, but mostly took care of [PAWN_objective]self using [PAWN_possessive] own survival skills.
LanguageData.Loner61.title: відлюдник
LanguageData.LoreKeeper51.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of a long line of lore keepers in [PAWN_possessive] tribe. Every night around the fire, [PAWN_pronoun] would pass on ancient knowledge and helpful wisdom through stories.
LanguageData.LoreKeeper51.title: хранитель знань
LanguageData.Malingerer28.description: [PAWN_nameDef] often feigned sickness in order to avoid [PAWN_possessive] responsibilities. While resting in the sick hut, [PAWN_pronoun] told stories to the children.
LanguageData.Malingerer28.title: симулянт
LanguageData.MuffaloShaman95.description: Because of [PAWN_possessive] quiet wisdom and great strength, [PAWN_nameDef] became the spiritual guide for [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] had a special connection with the great spirit of the muffalo.
LanguageData.MuffaloShaman95.title: шаман-муффало
LanguageData.PlankCutter72.description: [PAWN_nameDef] helped [PAWN_possessive] tribe build huge wooden structures by cutting trees into sturdy planks. [PAWN_nameDef] developed a fine understanding of how wood grows and splits.
LanguageData.PlankCutter72.title: столяр
LanguageData.Scout59.description: Since [PAWN_possessive] tribe made contact with local outlanders, [PAWN_nameDef] contracted [PAWN_possessive] services out as a guide. Frequent contact with ancient technology made [PAWN_objective] comfortable with the lost machines.
LanguageData.Scout59.title: розвідник племені
LanguageData.StewKeeper95.description: [PAWN_nameDef] prepared meals from the plants and animals brought in by gatherers, farmers, and hunters of [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] had to make sure it was calorie-efficient, long-lasting, and healthy. [PAWN_pronoun] often processed and sometime gathered plants [PAWN_objective]self.
LanguageData.StewKeeper95.title: кухар племені
LanguageData.Tamer79.description: [PAWN_nameDef]'s role in [PAWN_possessive] tribe was to connect with the natural world around - especially the world of animals. In addition to fulfilling a spiritual role, [PAWN_pronoun] also tamed wild beasts and cared for them as they served the tribe.
LanguageData.Tamer79.title: духовний тваринник
LanguageData.TreehouseBuilder86.description: [PAWN_nameDef] built houses among, and sometimes suspended in, the trees for [PAWN_possessive] people to use while traveling or foraging. [PAWN_nameDef] learned how to best find and use wild plants, and how to fight off wild animals.
LanguageData.TreehouseBuilder86.title: лісовий будівельник
LanguageData.VengefulHunter32.description: Following the death of a close friend by animal attack, [PAWN_nameDef] hunted the beast responsible. [PAWN_pronoun] tracked it to a nearby village, only to find one of the villagers wearing its pelt.
LanguageData.VengefulHunter32.title: мстивий мисливець
LanguageData.Warrior94.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a fearsome warrior, proficient with many weapons. [PAWN_pronoun] participated in many battles.
LanguageData.Warrior94.title: воїн
LanguageData.Weaver63.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was an expert at working wool, plant fibers and natural dyes into beautiful clothing for [PAWN_possessive] kin. [PAWN_possessive] handicrafts were traded frequently with other settlements.
LanguageData.Weaver63.title: кравець
